links.*: Arda Reconstructed: The Creation of the Published Silmarillion
The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)

wikitext.*:
<noinclude>{{month|March}}
Events that occurred on 15 March.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1901]]''' - [[Robert Havard]], [[Inklings|Inkling]], is born.
* '''[[1942]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to John Kettle|a letter to John Kettle]].
* '''[[1965]]''' - Actress [[Robyn Malcolm]] is born.
* '''[[1969]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Amy Ronald (15 March 1969)|a letter to Amy Ronald]].
* '''[[1981]]''' - The second episode of [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|the 1981 radio adaptation]] of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio 4]].
* '''[[2009]]''' - ''[[Arda Reconstructed: The Creation of the Published Silmarillion]]'' is published.

==In Arda==
* {{TA|2510}}:
** [[Borondir]] is on his way in search of the [[Éothéod]].
* {{TA|2941}}: 
** [[Gandalf]] meets [[Thorin]] at [[the Prancing Pony]], and they devise a plan to rid [[Lonely Mountain|Erebor]] of [[Smaug]].
* {{TA|3019}}: 
** In the early morning the [[Witch-king]] breaks the [[Great Gate of Minas Tirith|Gates]] of [[Minas Tirith]].
** [[Denethor]] burns himself on a pyre. [[Faramir]] is rescued by [[Gandalf]] and [[Beregond]] and brought to the [[Houses of Healing]].
** The horns of the [[Rohirrim]] echo in the sides of [[Mindolluin]] at cockcrow.
** [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]]:
*** Death of [[Théoden]].
*** [[Éowyn]] slays the [[Witch-king]] with the assistance of [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]].
*** [[Aragorn]] arrives on [[Pelennor Fields|the battlefield]] and raises the [[standard of Elendil]] woven by [[Arwen]].
** [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] escape the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]] and begin their journey north along the [[Morgai]]. 
** The [[Battle under the trees]] in [[Mirkwood]] takes place. [[Thranduil]] drives back the enemy from [[Dol Guldur]].
** Second [[assaults on Lothlórien|assault]] on [[Lothlórien]].
